steps.text: Soak 1 cup of rice and 1/4 cup of urad dal in water for 4-5 hours.
After soaking, drain the water and grind the rice and urad dal together to make a smooth batter.
Add salt to taste and mix well.
Cover the batter and let it ferment overnight or for at least 8 hours.
Heat a tawa or griddle on medium heat.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the center of the tawa and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Drizzle some oil around the edges of the dosa and cook until the bottom turns golden brown.
Flip the dosa and cook the other side until it is cooked through.
Remove the dosa from the tawa and repeat the process with the remaining batter.
Serve the kari dosa hot with your favorite chutney or sambar.
